edge: Cyber attacks, also known as zero-day attacks, comprise a regular online security threat that exploit the weaknesses of an organization's infrastructure. These types of attacks have been contributing significantly to data breaches resulting in losses of money, time, and resources.
Zero-day attacks are a major contributor to data leaks that have led to losses of money, time, and resources.

Our solution to detect and prevent such attacks is a desktop application that monitors your network traffic in real time and looks for any anomalies or malicious activity that may be happening and works to minimize the damage caused by prevention.
Keywords: Zero day attacks, Attack detection, Machine Learning.

Our software utilizes a network flow collection tool called CIC Flowmeter to collect network flows from the user in real time. These flows are analyzed using a two layer approach. Protection is employed by blocking network port access for specific IP Addresses that have been flagged as malicious.
With a large portion of our public and private data being hosted on digital infrastructure, growing with the advantages of seamless connectivity is the threat of mounting cyber attacks.
occurs when criminals exploit unknown vulnerabilities in hardware or software, unbeknownst to manufacturers.
leaves developers with little time to identify and mitigate the damage, as they catch organizations off guard.
if undetected, this attack may inflict irreparable damage to essential system architecture.

protecting computer systems and networks from malicious attacks has become a critical concern in the current digital era, as cybercriminals, leveraging the power of the internet, are constantly searching for vulnerabilities in hardware and software that can be exploited to steal or corrupt data.

node_2: complexity and scale of cyber attacks
edge: within the rapidly expanding cyber security landscape, the complexity and scale of cyber attacks has grown exponentially.
